intro: Hoya santiagoi, commonly known as the Santiago Wanda, is a species of flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and waxy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale green, often with a subtle fragrance. Hoya santiagoi is well adapted to humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant. Its unique appearance and ease of care make it a popular choice among plant enthusiasts.
